title: Antibiotic Resistance in the Philippines: Environmental Reservoirs, Spillovers, and One-Health Research Gaps.
abstract: Antimicrobial resistance (AMR) remains a major health threat in the Philippines, where high antimicrobial use, intensive aquaculture, and recurrent typhoon-driven flooding and monsoon seasons shape distinctive transmission pathways. This narrative review synthesizes published Philippine data across clinical, agriculture, and environmental sectors to map evidence and gaps relevant to policy. Clinically, vancomycin resistant
